items.text: loops it into middle and leg, Mushfiqur makes a little room and drives to long-off
misreads the googly as he looks for the cover drive. But this ball is dangled that far outside off with the express purpose of producing that shot - that mistake. Inside edge past leg stump
eases himself legside of the legbreak on leg stump and drives to short cover
items.shortText: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: looks to flick a full delivery on leg stump through midwicket, but ends up with a leading edge to cover
items.postText: Morshed Bhuiyan: "India earns exactly 60 dot balls in first 15 overs! Its Huge. Bangladesh is surely (not) considering their such weakness, indeed same happening in every matches, repeatedly in ODI as well as T20s."

items.text: good length ball outside off, Mushfiqur defends well
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: continues playing the sweep and this time he nails it, reaching out in front of his body to drag a ball just outside off away to deep midwicket
the left-armer responds with a quicker delivery on off stump, Mushfiqur expects it, ready with a block to cover. He wants a single too but Mahmudullah isn't as keen
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: beats him as Mushfiqur plays a late cut to a ball that isn't quite as short
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: taps into the covers
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: reverse sweeps it straight to short third man. Soft dismissal, and it's resulted out of Jadeja's accuracy and India's field placements. There's very few runs available in front of the wicket. The left-arm spinner keeps attacking the stumps at high pace. Mushfiqur tries to find an unorthodox solution and pays for his lack of patience

dismissal.text: Mushfiqur Rahim c Chahal b Jadeja 21 (45b 1x4 0x6) SR: 46.66

items.text: tosses it up on leg stump, Mahmudullah blocks
beats him with a wicket legbreak - angled into off stump, pulling Mahmudullah forward and ripping past his outside edge
gets to the pitch of the ball on middle and blocks
stays legside of the ball to open up the cover area - single with a smooth drive

items.preText: Akshay: "Jadeja is making a strong statement here. His usefulness with bat may give him a upperhand in World Cup Squad ." --- Last time he took 3 wickets in an innings was was back in Oct 2014
items.text: gets squared up as he blocks a legbreak that drifts into leg stump and then spins off the pitch
items.shortText: Chahal to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: googly that Mosaddek doesn't pick, pressing forward to block and getting an inside edge to square leg
items.postText: Ashish: "Good news for Bangladesh is that Mahmudullah is on the crease and there are plenty of overs remaining."
items.shortText: Chahal to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: goes back to push the good length ball on off stump to cover
good length on middle, Mahmudullah keeps it out
slides it into leg stump, Mahmudullah puts his front leg aside to defend
a little bit of turn as he shirts his radar to off stump. Mahmudullah guides it to point
tosses it up on off stump, Mahmudullah slices it to the sweeper
makes him reach out in front of his body and secures a bit of an edge to short cover
items.postText:
Arun Pandian: "5 overs no boundaries good bowling"

Ahmar_Jami: "Mushfiqur Rahim is a very experienced player. What was he trying?. Why was he trying?. I felt he was trying to get out. I think it is one of the main reasons that BD cricket has not gone in the right direction. Experienced players have not shown enough maturity. He was set and should have stayed till end. Not much  batting left anyway" ---- And yet he handled that pressure so well against Sri Lanka, scoring 144.
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: closes the face to one that pitches outside leg and gets a leading edge into the off side
length ball that comes on dead straight around middle, inside-edged onto the back pad
now he gets one to spin away and Mahmudullah keeps it out
